landmarks.name: Statue of Liberty
facts: Dedicated on October 28, 1886
Gift from France to celebrate American independence
Symbol of freedom and democracy
Stands 305 feet tall from base to torch

landmarks.name: Empire State Building
facts: Completed in 1931
Was the world's tallest building for 40 years
Has 102 floors and 73 elevators
Iconic Art Deco skyscraper

landmarks.name: Central Park
facts: Opened in 1857
843 acres of urban oasis
Designed by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux
Features Bethesda Terrace and Bow Bridge

landmarks.name: Times Square
facts: Known as the 'Crossroads of the World'
Famous for its bright billboards and lights
Named after The New York Times building
Hosts the annual New Year's Eve ball drop

landmarks.name: Brooklyn Bridge
facts: Completed in 1883
First suspension bridge to use steel cables
Spans 1,595 feet across the East River
Designed by John A. Roebling

landmarks.name: Brown University
facts: Founded in 1764 as the College in the English Colony of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations
One of the nine colonial colleges chartered before the American Revolution
Ivy League university located in Providence, Rhode Island
Known for its Open Curriculum, allowing students to design their own course of study

landmarks.name: Sciences Library (Brown University)
facts: Part of Brown University's library system
Houses collections in biology, chemistry, physics, and environmental science
Opened in 1971 as the Sciences Library
Features modern study spaces and research facilities
